column4: I have a SVCD directory (with the EXT, MPEG2 directories, etc) which in sum is larger than 700 megs. How'd burn that onto a CD-R under Ubuntu?
and I can assume it will not wreck my CD-RW drive?
the directory is 743 MB in total
yeah I guess, it's a standard CD-R suited for 700 MB of payload data
so I guess that's a 800mb cd including error correction and stuff?
so will it still work with that?
I know this has something to do with the 700/800 MB difference in error correction, I just never tried burning this under Linux
error correcting is a gimme in most modern brning apps
what I mean is that if you fully use a 700 MB CD-R, the burning software will add roughly 100 MB of error correction redundancy
this redundancy is obviously already contained in my 743 megs directory
so I have to tell the burning software: don't add error correction, it's already been done
